alert.note: Alert for Ocean; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 1:17PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Ocean and south central Monmouth Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 117 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cedar Glen West, or 7 miles northwest of Toms River, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Lakewood, Jackson, Lakehurst, Cassville, Vista Center, Leisure Village, Ramtown, Pleasant Plains, Cedar Glen West, Jacksons Mills, Leisure Village East, Leisure Village West-Pine Lake Park, Freewood Acres, Holiday City-Berkeley, Holiday City South, Allenwood, Silver Ridge and Leisure Knoll. This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 19 and 27. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 82 and 95. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
